thread.title: Angola: Economy Minister Emphasizes Public-Private Partnership
thread.title_full: Angola: Economy Minister Emphasizes Public-Private Partnership

title: Angola: Economy Minister Emphasizes Public-Private Partnership
text:
Liberia: Nimbaians Push for Privatization of Energy Sector Soyo — The minister of Economy, Abrao Gourgel, reiterated Thursday in Soyo district, northern Zaire province, that the Government will continue to improve public-private partnership aimed at contributing to the diversification of the national economy. The Cabinet minister who was speaking at the opening ceremony of mineral water processing factory called "Mpampam" added that the Government inserted in its National Development Plan (NDP) for the 2013/2017 period, a set of policies and measures to support the entrepreneurship. Among the strategies, the minister highlighted the access to credit and banking finance for micro, small and medium enterprises, as well as to fund capital risk, simplifying administrative procedures and cutting red tape. He said the way the government has implemented the program "Angola invests" in order to help companies obtain financing from banking institutions to comply with its objects. Angola
